definition: to pierce with or as if with a sharp object : stab
examples: She jabbed the steak with her fork.
The nurse jabbed the needle into my arm.

definition: to poke quickly or abruptly : thrust
to strike with a short straight blow

examples: We joke around. … I was jabbing him about injuries he's had.

definition: to make quick or abrupt thrusts with a sharp object
to strike a person with a short straight blow
to pointedly tease, mock, or make fun of someone
examples: At a moment's notice, he can produce a months-old editorial cartoon jabbing at him and seems genuinely hurt by the message.

definition: an act of jabbing, a short straight boxing punch delivered with the leading hand
a pointed and often mocking comment or criticism
examples: He has a lot of fun with Ranovic, the oh-so-dramatic, eager young undercover cop who consistently fails to understand Salter's ironic jabs.
Undeterred, McCain continues with his standard stump speech, leaving in all the anti-Bush jabs.

definition: an injection of something (such as medicine) into one's body with a needle
examples: … he would be the first in line to get a jab of the approved coronavirus vaccine if he could …
We're averaging 3 million jabs in arms a day.
